instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2390: What is 820-2390? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but does not run on battery, but system recognizes battery & is charging it.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but does not run on battery, but system recognizes battery & is charging it.

Hello to all members. Watched video about similar problem in MacBook air board [URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u14u1q_GjRg[/URL], but in MBP 17" this switching power supply works a bit different, board is clean, checked data lines and pull up resistors - they are fine (so system can see and charge the battery) - but I do not quite understand how switching into battery power works in this MacBook. checked F7040 & F7041 8A FUSES, they are fine <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> - seems to be fine too , maybe <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> - LT3470A is bad or some components around it? If somebody can give me some advices it would be great. Board is not liquid damaged, works perfect but system does not run on battery (all reset done before testing so it is hardware issue - also tested on two different batteries).

TIA Sebastian

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but does not run on battery, but system recognizes battery & is charging it.
threads.message:
Check F7040/41 voltage with battery only.
If 0V, then check if <TRANSISTOR>Q7056</TRANSISTOR>/58 have low voltage at Gate pin.

If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> OK, check <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> voltages.
"seems to be fine" is not valid here (measure); it has 2 diodes inside.
